file_content.text: Everyone's aboard, Plex! Get us out of here, now!
We're safe! You did it--you did what no one else could have done. You've saved us all.
We owe you our lives... every one of us. So, on behalf of the passengers and crew of the Republic transport Esseles, thank you.
It's been an honor to help and protect you all.
You're welcome.
If you hadn't been here, we'd all have been doomed. We can't thank you enough.
We all just do our part.
There's no reason for modesty. What you accomplished here is truly amazing.
I hope those thanks come with a hefty reward.
Let's talk compensation.
Of course, of course. Heroism deserves to be rewarded.
I took up a collection from everyone on the ship--hopefully, these credits will help you save other people in need, the same way you've saved us.
That's very kind of you.
You deserve far more.
More would've been better, but I'll get by.
I guess this will do.
Don't forget that bonus I promised for that extra bit of help. I'd say you've done quite well for yourself.
You could've had more, of course. But--
Please--keep your credits. I'm sure you all need them more than me.
I don't need a reward.
That's extremely gracious of you. Thank you very much.
Ambassador Asara, it's... it's a relief to see that you made it back to us safely as well.
Really? I imagine it comes as a bit of a surprise to see me here at all, Haken.
I--I don't know what you mean. Of course I'm glad to see you. Why would you think differently?
I just thought the ambassador ought to know the full facts of the situation.
I told her everything.
You offered me a reward to leave her on the Grand Moff's ship, Haken.
No more lies.
You must have misunderstood me. I would never... I wouldn't do something like that.
I don't know what she's talking about.
Don't look at me.
Oh, it's nothing. Just a small matter I'll be discussing with some friends once we reach Coruscant.
Thank you for telling me the truth and for everything else you've done here. The Republic needs heroes like you now more than ever.
It's a relief to be back, Haken. I'm just glad that this is all finally over.
We're finally safe. I want to thank you again for everything you've done. Heroes like you are hard to come by--and the Republic needs everyone they can get.
The Jedi will always be there to help those in need.
I was glad to help.
Then the Republic is very fortunate to have your order for allies.
I merely followed the guidance of the Force.
It was nothing, really.
Well, whatever it is you do, I'd say keep doing it.
I'm honored to fight for the Republic.
That's why I signed up.
And the Republic is lucky to have you.
I just do what I can when things get rough.
Happy to help.
Well, what you did here was incredible.
I'm no hero.
I mean it. If you hadn't been here, we would all be dead for certain.
Don't try to pull me into any more of your problems, Asara. I've got more urgent things to deal with.
Spare me the speeches.
I wouldn't dream of it.
I should warn you, though. Grand Moff Kilran is never going to forget what we've done. He'll stop at nothing to get his revenge.
Sounds like I'd better keep my guard up from now on.
Thanks for the warning.
That would be wise. There's nothing Kilran isn't capable of.
If Kilran thinks he can take us, he's in for a surprise.
He can try.
If Kilran wants to try me again, that's fine.
He can try.
Just be sure to stay alert from now on. Kilran is full of surprises.
I can't believe you dragged me into this mess.
All thanks to you.
It was never my intention to involve you or anyone else. But I'm certainly fortunate that you were here--we all are.
Anyway, enough of that. I'd say it's about time we all relaxed a bit and enjoyed the rest of our trip. Thanks again--and good luck in the future.
What about the other reward you promised?
We talked about more.
I have it right here. Thank you for settling the matter.
It's a shame Ambassador Asara had to lay down her life so that the rest of us could escape.
The Republic is fortunate to have heroes like Asara. And like you.
A Jedi lives to protect those in need.
I was glad to help.
It's good to know we've got the Jedi on our side.
I simply feel the Force, and let it direct my actions.
It was nothing, really.
I won't pretend to understand that. Whatever it is you do, it works.
Fighting for the Republic is my life, sir.
That's why I signed up.
And I'd say you do the Republic proud.
I just try to lend a hand where I can.
Happy to help.
You did more than lend a hand here. You saved us all.
I just wanted to get out of this alive, like everyone else.
I'm no hero.
That doesn't change the fact that you're the only reason any of us made it out alive at all.
If you want to lie and make yourself feel better, go ahead. But leave me out of it.
Spare me the speeches.
Hm. Suit yourself.
One thing's for sure, Grand Moff Kilran won't forget about this anytime soon. He's going to want revenge; count on it.
We should all be on our guard from now on.
You're right about that.
It's better than the alternative, that's for sure.
I beat Kilran once, I can beat him again.
No problem.
We defeated Kilran once, we can do it again.
No problem.
Just be sure to watch your back from now on.
Asara was Kilran's target. I don't think he cares about us.
Kilran got what he wanted.
Even so, you made his work much harder than it should've been.
Anyway, enough of that talk. It's time I got back to the helm. Enjoy the rest of your trip--and thanks again for everything you've done.
Just think about it, all right?
First Officer Haken, do you have any spare shuttles in the hangar bay?
Spare shuttles? Yes, we do, but I don't--
Then that's our only chance. You have to board Grand Moff Kilran's ship and disable the tractor beam so that we can all escape.
If this is what must be done to save the people on this ship, then I'll do it.
You can count on me.
It's a desperate plan, but Kilran certainly won't be expecting it.
Consider it done.
Head-on assault, surgical strike and rapid exfiltration. No problem.
Understood, ma'am.
A bit of fancy flying followed by some daring heroics? You've come to the right person.
I'm in.
I knew we could count on you.
We've been fighting insane odds all along. No sense stopping now.
Why not?
You can't be serious.
We've asked a lot of you, I know. But unless you can do this, everything else will be for nothing.
I've been aboard warships like Kilran's. The tractor beam controls should be easy to find, if you know where you're going.
Ambassador, you're familiar with the layout, perhaps you should go along to help get the tractor beam shut down.
Hmm. We need every advantage we can get.
It will be good to have you along, Ambassador.
Sounds like a plan.
I'll do my best to help in any way I can.
I don't know about this.
I can't babysit you over there, Ambassador. You're not going.
No way.
Look, if there's any chance I could make a difference, then we have to try.
Ambassador, before you go--take a spare uniform. We wouldn't want any Imperials to recognize you.
Good thinking, Commander--thank you. Now let's get moving.
Good luck out there. We're all counting on you.
You can do it!
Get to the air lock. The Imperials are right on top of us!
Come on, Tyrus! You can make it, sir, you can make it!
He's gone, sir. You're in charge now--what are our orders?
Your orders? Our weapons are out, shields are out, comms are out! There's nothing we can do!
I've come to offer my services in defense of the ship.
I'm here to help.
If you want to be useful, Jedi, then get out of here and stop interrupting us!
The path may not always be clear, but that doesn't mean there is no path.
Don't give up hope.
Why is this Jedi standing on our bridge spouting nonsense? We're in a situation here!
It sounds like you guys could use a captain with some experience.
Need a hand?
Who is this? Who do you think you are? Get out!
Give me a sitrep, people--what have we got?
What's going on?
Is your hearing bad, soldier? Because I'm pretty sure I just went over that.
Panicking won't help.
This is pathetic.
Who asked you? We're in the middle of a situation here, the bridge is off-limits.
Sir, we need all the help we can get. If we don't keep it together here, we're finished.
Keep what together? The Imperials have us by the throat! We're as good as dead already.
What's wrong with you? Are you really going to let your ship fall to the Imperials so easily?
Get it together!
That ship behind us is one of the biggest in the Imperial fleet. We didn't stand a chance.
Don't be so negative.
I just can't believe this is happening.
Are the engines still working? Is there any chance we could run?
We should make a break for it.
The engines are operational, but we're caught in a tractor beam. Impossible to run for it.
Sir! Incoming message--the Imperial ship is hailing us!
What? Oh. Well, put them on.
Republic transport Esseles, this is Grand Moff Rycus Kilran. Your defenses are entirely disabled. Attempt no resistance.
We're aware of our situation, Kilran. Just tell us why you're here.
What do you want from us?
We can talk this through.
Come, now. I think it's obvious I'm not here for friendly diplomacy.
If you think we're easy prey, Kilran, you're wrong--we'll fight you to our last breath!
You'll never take us alive!
Don't listen to her! She doesn't speak for all of us!
We'll fight you and your Imperial lackeys to the bitter end, Kilran!
You'll never take us alive!
Ignore that man! He doesn't represent us!
I don't care who's representing you. I'm not here to negotiate.
Your ship is transporting a known anti-Imperial terrorist and seditionist: the so-called "Ambassador" Vyn Asara. I've come to collect her.
Who? We didn't take on any passengers by that name. I've never even heard of this person!
Interesting. Lying or incompetent? No matter. My agents aboard your ship have confirmed the ambassador is there.
You have spies aboard our ship?
Your agents?
I have eyes everywhere.
Obviously, your "agents" are misinformed. The first officer just told you that there's no ambassador aboard.
This is a mistake.
You'll forgive me if I don't take his word for it, my friend.
What are you going to do about it, Kilran? You can't force us to hand this person over.
So what?
I'm fairly confident that I can.
Imperial soldiers are preparing to board your ship through its primary air lock. My agents will ensure that you do not interfere with them.
If you attempt to stop my men from arresting Ambassador Asara, I will have every living thing aboard the Esseles killed.
Where is the primary air lock? I'll stop the Imperials as they try to board.
We have to defend the ship!
Weren't you listening? If we try to fight, they'll slaughter us! We have to cooperate!
If we just hand over this ambassador person, we can all be on our way.
Let them have what they want.
This is bad.
Let's not panic. We just figure out who this ambassador is and hand her over. No problem.
It won't matter. Kilran has us, now. He'll kill us all--he's famous for it. The only one he wants alive is the ambassador.
If Kilran gets the ambassador while we're sitting in his sights, we're goners. Those soldiers have to be stopped before they can succeed.
I'll ensure that no Imperial soldiers make it aboard this ship.
You can count on me.
I'll show these Imperials the error of their ways.
Leave it to me.
I'll give these Imperials a welcome they'll never forget.
Let me handle this.
I can hold the line against a pack of Imps any day.
Understood.
It's very brave of you to volunteer.
I'm glad we're all on the same page here.
Good to know you agree.
Listen--I'm sorry I lost it earlier.
It means a lot to have your help right now. Thank you.
No need for thanks.
Maybe so, but we appreciate your help all the same.
I enjoy a challenge.
I'm sure you're up to anything the Imps can throw at us.
Don't get any big ideas. I just want to make it through this.
I'm not doing this for you.
Trust me, you aren't the only one.
Is fighting a good idea?
We'll never pull that off.
We don't have any choice. Everything we have goes to the primary air lock, or we're done. And that includes you.
Look, I'm sorry I lost it before, all right? I'm in over my head here--we all are. But if you don't stop those Imperial soldiers, we're all dead.
Very well.
Keep those Imperials off the ship while we figure out a way to get out of here. That's all.
Will I be compensated?
We can talk about rewards later. You just worry about keeping those Imperials off our ship.
It isn't my job to keep you people alive!
This isn't my responsibility!
It is today. Besides, you'll be keeping yourself alive, too.
I'll have our security team meet you by the primary air lock. They haven't seen much action, but Commander Narlock knows his stuff.
Good luck. We're all counting on you.
I can't talk now.
You did it!
Get us out of here!
